title: HYBRID Korean Speaking Registered Nurse (RN), UAS Assessor, (full-time position, training provided).
description:
**Seeking Korean speaking Registered Nurses. Positions are available in Nassau/Suffolk, Staten Island, Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens, and Manhattan.**

We are seeking an energetic, tech savvy, organized, and a highly detailed Registered Nurse to join our workforce full time.

This opportunity is for new grad RN's or for seasoned RN's who want to transition in building a career in the home care managed long term care (MLTC) industry. This full-time position offers **EXTREME FLEXIBILITY** and **AUTONOMY** for a real work-life balance with an award-winning leadership team. We are the ONLY organization that provides **comprehensive** training to certify Registered Nurses as UAS Nurse Assessors. This position is **NON SKILLED**; you do not touch the patient, instead, you perform a health assessment (interview the patient) which will determine the patient's eligibility for home care services. These assessments are either done **in-person** at the patient’s home or via **Telehealth** modality (FaceTime, etc).

The RN has to have a personal vehicle or have access to public transportation to be able to travel within their assigned borough. The RN will be responsible to complete THREE assessments per day as their daily quota (15 assessments/week). If an RN completes more than three assessments on any given day, then they will be eligible for a bonus structure (starts after 90-day probation period) **which can greatly increase the overall yearly salary.** Consideration will be given to RNs that are bilingual.

**Qualifications:**

* Excellent written documentation skills required.
* Excellent computer skills are required.
* Must have access to a personal vehicle to travel within the assigned borough.
* Strong preference will be given to bilingual nurses.

**\\*\\*\\*Please make sure to respond to all screening questions when submitting your resume via Indeed.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health

Physical Setting:

* Long term care

* Bonus opportunities
* Weekly bonus

title: Accounting and Billing Specialist
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a detail-oriented Accounting and Billing Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in medical collections, accounts receivable, and financial concepts.

**Responsibilities:**

* Financial Transactions: Record daily financial transactions, including accounts payable and receivable.
* Expense Management: Track and manage firm expenses, ensuring they are recorded accurately.
* Financial Reporting: Generate financial reports to assist in strategic decision-making.
* Compliance: Ensure adherence to relevant accounting standards and legal requirements.
* Reconciliation: Perform account reconciliations to ensure accuracy and completeness of financial records.
* Taxation: Prepare and file requisite documents for taxation compliance.
* Trust Accounting: Handle trust accounts in compliance with legal regulations.
* Billing and Payments: Manage client billing processes, including preparing and sending invoices, and tracking payments. Timely processing of arbitration fee payments.
* Communication: Communicate with clients regarding billing inquiries and payment arrangements.

**Qualifications:**

* Education: A bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a related field preferred.
* Experience: 2+ years of bookkeeping experience, preferably in a legal setting.
* Technical Proficiency: Working knowledge in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Salesforce, MS Excel), strong attention to detail, and excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with clients and team members.
* Ethical Standards: Maintain high ethical standards and confidentiality.

title: Laboratory Technician- Medical Office $18/hour Full time
description:
**Pediatric Healthcare of Long Island** is a busy private Pediatric practice, serving the infants, children, adolescents, and young adults on the south shore of Long Island. We strive to provide excellent, comprehensive care for well and sick children. In order to accomplish this, we have extensive, high tech in-office laboratories, staffed full-time by clinical lab technicians.

**LOCATION:** Woodmere and Bellmore, NY. The lab tech will be reporting to **both locations**. **Dependable transportation is required.**

**Laboratory Technician Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Prepare, order, and send out lab specimens going to an outside lab
* Perform all in-house lab tests: CBC, lead test, rapid strep test, strep PCR test, urinalysis, urine culture, flu test, estimated sedimentation rate, respiratory viral panel
* Run controls and proficiency testing on all in-office lab tests and documenting the results accurately
* Vaccine inventory
* Monitor temperature logs on all refrigerators and freezers and report excursions to the administrative staff promptly
* Use each piece of equipment appropriately and report any issues to the Practice Administrator.

**SCHEDULE FOR HIRE: The schedule consists of 2 alternating weeks: Hours are non-negotiable and must be sustainable long term.**

Week 1: Monday-OFF, Tuesday-2pm-close (815pm), Wednesday-2pm-close (815pm), Thursday-2pm-close (815pm), Friday-8am-close (615pm), Saturday-9am-close (315pm), Sunday-9am-close (215pm) = 40.5h

Average Total = 40.25h

title: Consulting Utility Forester
description:
As our next Consulting Utility Forester, you’re on your way to the open road and traveling the trails! We keep the lights on anywhere there’s a power line - whether in the city, the rural countryside, or deep in the remote forest. As a Consulting Utility Forester, you’ll keep communities informed about the trees and power lines, while ensuring safe delivery of their power and pursuing opportunities to develop sustainable habitat throughout the utility right-of-way. In this role, your office is the great outdoors!  

  

Eocene Environmental Group, Inc. is an employee-owned company with a strong commitment to recruiting and developing the best talent in the utility vegetation management industry. As our company continues to expand across the country and beyond, new career opportunities become available.  

  

**Working for Eocene Environmental Group could be your next great job if:*** You love talking to new people, being outside, and working independently.
* You have strong problem-solving skills and pay close attention to detail.
* You’re willing to learn. We provide ongoing training and assistance in obtaining industry-related certifications.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCITONS**:* Contact property owners & public agencies regarding pruning and/or removals.
* Conduct tree and brush inventories.
* Conduct hazard tree inspections and evaluations.
* Plan work for tree contractors.
* Manage data.
* Safeguard employees and public from hazards in and around the work area.
* Enforce on-the-job safety practices.
* Carry and utilize materials, tools, and equipment at work site.
* Service trucks and equipment, keep trucks and other assigned equipment in a neat and orderly fashion.
* Perform other related duties as required or assigned.


**REQUIREMENTS:*** Degree in forestry or related field and/or experience in utility line clearance.
* Species identification skills and invasive species knowledge, plus knowledge of tree growth rates.
* Ability to obtain ISA Arborist Certification within 12 months upon job offer.
* Valid driver’s license with clean driving record.
* Ability to work independently.
* Strong verbal and written communications skills.
* Excellent customer service skills a priority.
* Ability to travel and work in rugged terrain and inclement weather.
* Proficient in map navigation skills.
* Experience with Microsoft Office and data collection software (GIS experience a plus).

  

**To move forward in the process, we require you to complete an application on our careers page. Please follow the below link to apply:**  

  

Apply Here

West Des Moines, IA 50266

title: Collibra Quality Analyst (QA)
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a highly skilled **Collibra Data Governance Quality Analyst(QA)** to join our team. The ideal candidate will manage product development, analyze business requirements, and translate them into technical specifications. You will play a key role in defining the product roadmap, driving enhancements, creating user stories, and ensuring a high-quality user experience. Additionally, you will collect and analyze user feedback to refine the product roadmap and provide support to data producers and consumers on our marketplace. Also, Plan and coordinate various testing activities, including **User Acceptance Testing (UAT)**, to ensure that the product meets the required standards. Track and manage defects, working with the development team to resolve issues. **A high level of experience with Collibra, including its data model and functionalities, Python and Beautiful Soap and proficiency in SQL are essential for this role.**

**Duties** -

* **Deep knowledge of the Collibra Data Governance tool** to ensure thorough testing and validation of governance processes and workflows.
* **Test and validate integration scripts that connect Collibra with other tools such as GPT, Data Quality (DQ) systems**, and more, ensuring seamless interoperability.
* Develop, maintain, and optimize scripts for **automating Collibra workflow testing,** enhancing the efficiency and consistency of QA processes.
* Develop and implement automated testing strategies to validate the outcomes of integrated systems, ensuring data accuracy and consistency across platforms.
* **Perform validation of reports and data visualizations in Qlik or Tableau Dashboards to ensure the integrity and accuracy of governance metrics and KPIs.**
* Analyze business requirements in detail and write exhaustive test cases that cover a wide range of scenarios, ensuring thorough coverage.
* Provide clear and concise communication of testing results, risks, and recommendations to stakeholders, ensuring informed decision-making.
* Identify opportunities for improving QA processes, tools, and methodologies, contributing to ongoing enhancement of testing efficiency and effectiveness.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of QA processes, test cases, and results, ensuring transparency and traceability.
* Ensure all testing activities align with established industry standards, best practices, and compliance requirements for data governance.
* Quickly adapt to new tools, technologies, and methodologies within the data governance domain, staying current with industry trends and advancements.

**Requirements** -  
\\*  
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (such as Engineering, Computer Science) and a minimum of 5 years of experience.

* Technical Skills: High level experience with Collibra, including its data model and functionalities, is essential. Strong proficiency in SQL is required. **Experience with Collibra workflow. Knowledge of Beautiful Soap for scrapping of data. Basic working knowledge in Python coding.** Familiarity with data management and analytics tools. Proficient in using Jira for managing projects and tracking progress. Understanding of user interface design and user experience principles. Ability to work closely with designers to create user-centric solutions.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Do you possess a High Level Collibra Workflow knowledge for performing UAT?

Experience:

* Data governance: 3 years (Required)
* SQL: 5 years (Required)
* Jira: 3 years (Required)
* Collibra Data Governance: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

title: Business Development Representative (BDR) Resident
description:
Kickstart your technical sales career with real experience and zero risk!

Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey in the dynamic world of sales? Our innovative program is designed to give you the edge you need to succeed in this competitive industry.

We believe in removing barriers to your success. That's why we offer:

* Tuition-free training: Gain top-tier sales education without the financial burden.
* 3-months of support: We continue to support you for the first three crucial months on your job, ensuring a smooth transition into your new role.

About SV Academy:

SV Academy is your fast track to a rewarding career in the tech industry. With personalized coaching and industry-aligned curriculum, we've helped over 5000 graduates from diverse backgrounds launch successful careers in sales and business development.

This is a unique opportunity to participate in our comprehensive BDR Residency. which consists of a free one-week training period followed by a full-time W2, salaried, 12-week Fellowship with one of our Employer Partners (EPs), currently operating in Europe, and expanding to the US. Residents will receive hands-on training, mentorship, and real-world experience to prepare them for a successful career in software sales. BDRs are pivotal to the sales cycle by focusing on top-of-funnel activities, including gathering prospect data, educating prospects, qualifying leads, and booking meetings. This role is essential for driving growth and expanding the customer base, making it a key entry point for careers in tech sales.

Key Role Responsibilities for your Residency:

As the first BDR working full-time on this company’s US launch, you will have a significant impact on market strategy in the US and in developing their international business. This Series A company has recently raised capital and is beginning their US go-to-market (GTM) efforts. They are accelerating product development, offering you a tremendous opportunity to shape their growth and the products created. You are joining at the ideal time to make a substantial impact.

Work on Cutting-Edge Technology: Headquartered in France, we are revolutionizing the industry by combining AI, 3D, and eCommerce trends into a truly unique product. Join us and be a part of this exciting journey, pushing the boundaries of what's possible and creating groundbreaking solutions that will define the future of marketing

Team Our team members and founders are video experts with previous work experience at giants like: Spotify Meta/Facebook, Instagram, and Snapchat. You will join a Sales team made up of 4-5 EMEA AEs, 4 SDRs, a Lead gen/SDR Manager and a Head of Sales.

* Conduct high-volume Outbound prospecting and lead generation using multiple channels (cold calls, email, LinkedIn, Social Media, trade shows, your network etc.)
* Efficient Inbound handling and qualification in close collaboration with Account Executives
* Devise creative ideas for more leads, sales, and partners as well as personalized follow-up and engagement strategies
* Contribute to better sales outreach and process automation with tooling
* Monitor and report KPIs to ensure our strategy stays informed by data
* Coordinate needs, develop and negotiate contracts, and integrate contract requirements with business operations to close new business
* Liaise with peers across different markets to refine processes and evolve the scope of the role
* Stay on top of the latest product features, industry trends, and market dynamics to provide the best possible service to our clients.

Requirements:

* Outbound B2B SaaS sales experience highly-preferred
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
* Self-starter: autonomous, driven, and proactive, with a hunger for commercial development and new challenges in an ever-evolving space
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to build effective relationships with clients and colleagues
* Prioritization and time management, maintaining focus in a fast-paced environment
* Contribute to building a positive culture and help shape our footprint in a new region
* Experience with lead generation (CRMs like Hubspot, prospecting tools, etc.)

What We Offer:

* Scholarship to our intensive boot camp, followed by a full-time, 12-week Residency with the Employer Partner as a W2 Employee.
* Hands-on training, mentorship, and guidance from industry experts and experienced sales professionals.
* Opportunity to gain practical technical sales experience and develop valuable skills for a successful career in business development.
* Access to networking events, career development workshops, and ongoing support from SV Academy.
* Supportive Environment: Collaborative and supportive team culture.
* Competitive Compensation: Monthly stipend during Residency/Fellowship and Base salary with performance-based incentives and benefits as an FTE with the EP.

Job Type: Full-Time Employment (FTE)

Compensation: Competitive Base Salary + Commission and StandardBenefits Pkg

How to Apply: Submit your updated resume online. Qualified candidates will be invited to participate in the interview process.

title: Pet Sitter/Dog Walker - Permanent P/T
description:
Come join our team of heart-centered animal caretakers!

Would you like to have a job where you get fresh air, play with dogs and cats, and have a dynamic, ever-changing schedule that doesn't leave you bored? Peace, Love & Petsitting, LLC is the premier professional pet care company based in Hamilton, NJ. We are looking for candidates to work five days per week, who are responsible, dependable animal lovers to distribute peace and love to the animals we care for. Previous work experience or volunteer work with animals a plus, but not mandatory. Successful applicants must live in or very near our service area. (Hamilton, Robbinsville, or West Windsor.) They will also have a reliable car, a smart phone, and have \\*excellent\\* grammar and people skills. We schedule visits from approximately 7:30 AM until 9:30 PM, seven days a week, including holidays. Responsibilities will primarily include dog walking, feeding, clean-up of accidents, playing and, importantly, loving the fur-friends in our care.

Your schedule will start out with visits dependent on current client demand, and your schedule will develop over time. There is room for growth based on performance and your availability. If you'd like to be part of our team, please send a letter of interest (in the cover letter section) and resume (if you have one, even if it's not pet related). Let us know any experience you have with animals, and why you think you'd make a good pet sitter. Applications without this info will not be reviewed.

You may also fill out a questionnaire by going to www.peaceloveandpetsitting.NET and click on "Join Our Team!" We look forward to hearing from you!

description:

As a Lead Dental Assistant, you will be responsible for providing chairside assistance to dentists, ensuring efficient and smooth workflow, and supervising and training other dental assistants. In this role, you will assist with various dental procedures, prepare treatment rooms, sterilize instruments, take X-rays, and provide chairside support to the dentists.

Our comprehensive training program ensures that you're equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary for success in this role. From understanding dog behavior and breed intricacies to mastering client interactions and conflict resolution, we'll guide you through every aspect of the job.

This position is to fill evening walks on Wednesday/Thursday - Sunday starting at 4pm/5pm until 10:30pm/11pm. You will walk with a maximum of 3-dogs, but evening walks are typically solo or two dogs. The training may take 2-4 weeks and if possible may include daytime training as well.

As a Lucky Dog walker, you'll be required to climb stairs, safely lift 40 lbs, maintain focus during walks, and engage in social interactions. You'll be a vital part of our clients' pets' lives.

title: Shipping and Logistics Coordinator
description:
Job Description:  
As a leading brand within the consumer goods industry, we are looking for an experienced and talented **Shipping and Logistics Coordinator** to join our expanding logistics team.

As the **Shipping and Logistics Coordinator** you will be responsible for working with the **Manager of Distribution and Logistics**, assisting with all aspects of shipping and fulfillment to ensure the products are delivered to customers in a timely and cost-efficient manner. This role requires strong leadership in managing freight partners, inventory, and order fulfillment processes while working from our Bridgewater, NJ office.

**What You'll Do**

* **Order and Shipment Management**: Handle orders and shipments for all major customers.
* **Warehouse Coordination:** Process picking tickets and coordinating with the warehouse on packaging, stock retrieval, and deliverables.
* **Label Processing:** Utilize ERP/WMS systems and various portals to create carton labels and UCC-128 shipping labels.
* **Routing and Scheduling:** Prepare routing information, schedule appointments with carriers, and manage shipping documents.
* **Purchase Order Routing:** Route purchase orders through designated portals and websites.
* **Compliance:** Access and adhere to customers’ online vendor compliance packing and shipping requirements. Maintain and update account records. Communicate packing and shipping requirements to the warehouse team.
* **EDI Job Functions:** Assist with Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes, including order processing, shipping notifications, and invoice generation.
* **Invoice and Payment Processing:** Support the Finance Team in invoice processing and research payments for discrepancies, shortages, and other claims or chargebacks.
* Ensure that warehouse and factory orders are finished to meet customer requirements in a timely manner.
* Collaborate with management and executive teams to enhance and improve department operations.
* Complete special projects as assigned.

**What You Need:**

* Minimum of 3 years in wholesale distribution and outbound logistics.
* Proven experience with major retailers and boutique order fulfillment and shipping.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel (intermediate skills required), and experience with on-premises or Cloud based ERP systems.
* Familiarity with department store routing compliance and EDI-related terminology and issues.
* Experience with online shipping software such as WMS, USPS, UPS WorldShip, and FedEx Shipping Manager.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and assignments simultaneously.
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to solve problems effectively.
* Experience working with cross-functional teams.
* A positive, dependable, self-motivated team player.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines.

If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for optimizing shipping processes and ensuring timely deliveries, we invite you to apply. Join us in our commitment to delivering exceptional service to our customers through efficient logistics management.

title: Director, Volunteer Services
description:
The USGA is a mission-based golf organization whose purpose is to unify the golf community through handicapping and grassroots programs; to showcase the game's best talent through the U.S. Open, U.S. Women's Open and 13 other national championships and our museum; to provide unbiased global governance with The R&A through the playing, equipment and Amateur Status rules; and to advance issues important to golf's future, with a focus on driving sustainability, accessibility and inclusion. As a nonprofit association, our work and our team are driven to act for the good of the game. The USGA's headquarters are located in Liberty Corner, NJ, with a recently opened campus in Pinehurst, NC. For more, visit usga.org.


**About this role:**



Volunteerism has been integral to the USGA's identity since our inception. Volunteers are crucial in carrying out our championships, promoting our programs, and fostering connections with local golf communities. Without volunteers, we could not achieve our mission.



The USGA is seeking a Director, Volunteer Services to support our 300+ National Committee Members (CMs). This role ensures the long-term sustainability of our volunteer network by creating the flexibility needed to deliver our championships and services while continually improving the CM experience.



The Director, Volunteer Services will serve as the primary contact for volunteers, acting as the interface between the USGA, the volunteer base, and the Allied Golf Association (AGA) communities. This role will be the strategic leader for communication and education of our CMs in coordination with Regional Affairs Directors nationwide.



Note: This position does not include the acquisition and support of temporary volunteers for the USGA Opens each year.


**What you'll do:**


* Providing centralized national support for surveying and assigning CMs to championships
* Collaborating with the Business Insights Analyst to develop and summarize CM surveys annually and post-championship, and to develop key tracking data points to monitor CM engagement and historical interactions with the USGA
* Identifying new volunteer opportunities, including evaluating a club ambassador program to drive greater adoption of USGA products and services at golf courses and improve the USGA's reputation at the local level, with a specific focus on supporting CMs without advanced or expert rules scores
* Serve as the main point of contact for the USGA's volunteer base
* Elevate the volunteer experience through education, engagement, and regular communication
* Foster stronger connections between USGA volunteers, AGAs, and local golf communities
* Continue modernizing our volunteer base to support the USGA's mission, programs, and services at local, national, and international levels
* Formalize our communications program to enhance the flow of information and feedback between the USGA, volunteers, and key constituents, while clarifying the roles of Regional Affairs Directors, the Communications team, and our Executive Administrative team
* Work directly with Championship Directors to ensure events are fully supported by the appropriate number of skilled volunteers while minimizing the time and financial burden on volunteers
* Partner with relevant USGA departments to create a volunteer continuing education program, covering topics such as officiating, staff interaction etiquette, championship on-course conduct, and promoting the value of a handicap index, USGA membership, and the Green Section mission
* Effectively use a CRM system to track volunteer activities, monitor the quality of the volunteer experience, and create a scorecard to evaluate performance and provide quantitative feedback, including potential certification levels
* Conduct ongoing evaluations of volunteer programs and services, recommending and implementing improvements as necessary


**Where you'll be:**


* This role can be based at our Liberty Corner, NJ campus on a hybrid schedule, or may work remotely. NJ-based employees are expected to spend 3 days per week working in the office, between Monday - Thursday. There is a travel component to this role - approximately 10-20% of time, working with our Championships, AGA staff, member clubs, and other allied organizations.


**What you bring:**


* 5+ years of experience in a golf organization with relevant experience leading volunteers or similar programs
* Bachelors degree in Business, Sport Management, or equivalent preferred
* Proven diplomacy and conflict resolution skills
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
* Public speaking experience
* Detail-oriented with strong multitasking abilities, and proven ability to work independently


**What the USGA brings:**


* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits, including a zero cost medical plan offered for all full-time employees
* Retirement plans, with a generous annual contribution from the USGA
* Suite of programs to promote physical, emotional, and financial well-being
* Generous bank of paid time off, plus the week between Christmas and New Years Day off
* Off-site team building events
* On-site gym and golf simulator
* Professional development opportunities


The USGA is an equal opportunity employer. Our organization believes we are stronger by embracing our diverse backgrounds and perspectives, promoting equity so all teammates can excel and grow in their careers, and fostering experiences to drive inclusion in our workplace and game. Golf is a game for everyone, and you are always welcome.

title: Automotive Service Manager
description:
**About Us:**

JA Autowerks, an award-winning European auto repair shop, is seeking a motivated and experienced Service Manager to lead our team. We specialize in providing top-quality service to European vehicle owners, and we're looking for a dynamic leader who can drive daily operations, motivate a skilled team, and ensure exceptional customer service.

**Why You Should Join JA Autowerks:**

* **Leadership Role:** Take charge of a talented team of technicians in a growing, stable company that values leadership and initiative.
* **Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy a top-tier salary with uncapped commission potential—our best team members thrive financially.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** We offer Health, Vision, Dental, and Life Insurance, an IRA with employer match, Paid Time Off, and holidays.
* **Work-Life Balance:** No weekend hours—Monday through Friday schedule, so you can enjoy your personal time.
* **Room for Growth:** JA Autowerks continues to expand, providing significant opportunities for career advancement and professional development.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Manage and oversee daily operations to ensure smooth workflows, high productivity, and satisfied customers.
* Lead and mentor a team of skilled technicians, helping them reach production goals.
* Sell repair services and maintenance using established company guidelines and best practices.
* Provide top-level customer service to discerning European vehicle owners who expect nothing but the best.

**Who We're Looking For:**

* **Leadership Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in a management or supervisory role, with a proven ability to lead a team.
* **Sales Expertise:** At least 8years of successful sales experience, preferably in the automotive or related industry.
* **Strong Communication Skills:** Excellent ability to connect with customers and manage relationships with your team.
* **Passion for European Cars:** Enthusiastic about European vehicles and committed to maintaining high-quality service standards.

**Ready to Elevate Your Career?**

If you're driven by leadership, success, and making an impact, we want to hear from you!

title: VIP Director - Casino
description:
**ABOUT FANDUEL**



FanDuel Group ("FanDuel") is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media.



FanDuel has a presence across all 50 states with approximately 17 million customers and 28 retail locations. FanDuel is based in New York with offices in New Jersey, Georgia, California, Oregon, Canada and Scotland.



Its networks FanDuel TV and FanDuel+ are broadly distributed on linear cable television and through its relationships with leading direct-to-consumer over-the-top platforms.



FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).


**THE ROSTER**



At FanDuel, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We're dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does "winning" look like at FanDuel? It's recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best work—and a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creatives professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of "We Are One Team" runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.


**THE POSITION**  

Our roster has an opening with your name on it



FanDuel Group is looking to expand its VIP department for our online casino. We are looking to recruit a VIP Accounts Area Director to manage operations of key casino state(s).



As a VIP Accounts Area Director, you will oversee Team Managers in your designated key state(s) and manage a VIP team who hosts a portfolio of high value customers. A key part of this team's role revolves around cultivating relationships with our VIP customer base to ensure that FanDuel is their top choice when it comes to Casino gaming. You will mentor your team to build strong relationships with their VIP customer portfolios in order to increase customer loyalty, while adhering to the highest compliance standards in the industry. A key part of the role will be managing a high performing team of Account Managers, Team Managers and/or Senior Managers who will be measured across multiple customer service metrics. This role will also liaise with other departments to identify new opportunities to enhance the FanDuel VIP value proposition for our customers.


**THE GAME PLAN**  

Everyone on our team has a part to play


* Effectively manage and coach a FanDuel Group VIP team in order to guide them towards KPIs geared around service levels and customer satisfaction
* Build out essential monthly / quarterly plans for your area's Account Managers, that execute the department's strategy
* Collaborate with other VIP Area Directors & Senior Managers to deliver a holistic view on FanDuel group VIP customers
* Be accountable for your team's Account Manager service scorecard performance
* Build strong development plans for each employee within your area
* Be the key escalation point for all VIP BAU issues that may arise
* Work with internal stakeholders on ensuring the highest quality training programs are in place, focusing on Compliance, Customer Experience and Professionalism
* Keep Compliance and Responsible Gaming at the heart of all we do
* Monitor overall team performance to ensure that bonuses, gifts, and hospitality invitations are offered in a responsible manner in accordance with business requirements
* Execute upon VIP Senior Director / VP's initiatives regarding performance & strategy
* Meet and host VIPs at Hospitality events and mentor team members to do the same
* Deliver against company Responsible Gaming protocols
* Provide strong leadership, professionalism and strategic planning for your Area


**THE STATS**  

What we're looking for in our next teammate


* Minimum of 8 years of experience in high end customer service field is essential
* Minimum of 5 years casino industry experience
* Minimum of 3 years of management experience
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Passionate and demonstrate the ability to provide top level service
* Confident and people focused personality
* Excellent analytical skills and experience with Excel
* Ability to interpret and present data to senior management
* Execute targets and deadlines


**PLAYER BENEFITS**  

We treat our team right



From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give. Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:


* An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
* Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
* Mentorship and professional development resources to help you refine your game
* Be well, save well and live well - with FanDuel Total Rewards your benefits are one highlight reel after another


FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principal states, "We Are One Team!" We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, Veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included. We want our team to include diverse individuals because diversity of thought, diversity of perspectives, and diversity of experiences leads to better performance. Having a diverse and inclusive workforce is a core value that we believe makes FanDuel stronger and more competitive as One Team!


***The applicable salary range for this position is $133,000 - $182,600, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.***

title: Porter/Maintenance
description:
We are looking for a responsible custodian to maintain and protect our facilities. The external and internal appearance of a building reflects on the occupants. It is important for a custodian, or janitor, to be careful and thorough in working, cleaning and tidying the premises, as well as preventing vandalism. The ideal candidate will be experienced in a custodian role focused on building upkeep. Along with a keen eye for detail and diligence are imperative in custodial maintenance jobs.

**Responsibilities**

* Ensure spaces are prepared for the next day by taking out trash, tidying furniture and dusting surfaces
* Sweep and mop floors and vacuum carpets
* Wash and sanitize toilets, sinks and showers and restock disposables (e.g. soap)
* Wipe mirrors and windows
* Maintain outer premises by watering plants, mowing lawn, cleaning entrances
* Utilize insecticides to prevent infestation by dangerous pests
* Perform maintenance and minor repairs (replacing broken switches, fixing door handles, minor leaks etc.)
* Report major damages and oversee repairs
* Secure facilities after operating hours by locking doors, closing windows and setting up the alarm
* Undertake occasional custodial and janitorial tasks (shoveling snow from the sidewalk, lifting heavy items, moving chairs etc.)

* Proven experience as custodian, janitor or in a similar role

title: Technical Editor
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Technical Editor with 3-5 years of experience in environmental consulting or a related field. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in editing technical documents, with the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment. You will play a critical role in ensuring that our reports, proposals, and other documents are accurate, clear, and aligned with industry standards and client expectations.

***The Role***

* Edit and proofread technical reports, proposals, and other documents for accuracy, clarity, grammar, and consistency.
* Collaborate with project managers and internal clients to ensure that content meets the required standards and is consistent with Terraphase’s style guide.
* Ensure that all documents adhere to Terraphase guidelines, Terraphase Style Guide, client requirements, and regulatory standards.
* Use Terraphase’s established calendar system to track project deadlines and coordinate with team members to ensure smooth workflow and timely submissions.
* Leverage the company’s Technical Editing Center to streamline the editing process, maintain consistency across documents, and ensure alignment with team expectations and project requirements.
* Work closely with the team to disseminate priorities, break down tasks, and allocate responsibilities. Focus work based on each team member’s strengths and weaknesses, ensuring that the team operates efficiently and effectively.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality documents.
* Provide constructive feedback to authors and contribute to the continuous improvement of document quality.
* Maintain a comprehensive understanding of environmental consulting terminology and practices.

***Who You Are***

* Bachelor’s degree in English, Environmental Science, Communications, or a related field.
* 3-5 years of experience as a technical editor, preferably in environmental consulting or a similar technical industry.
* Exceptional editing and proofreading skills, with a keen eye for detail.
* Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks with minimal supervision.
* Strong understanding of environmental terminology and regulatory requirements.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Adobe Acrobat.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

***Preferred Qualifications***

* Knowledge of environmental regulations and compliance standards.

***Who We Are***


We are an environmental and engineering consulting company that offers cost-effective solutions to complex environmental and engineering challenges. We apply technical expertise and keen awareness of the regulatory framework to achieve our clients' project goals and objectives. The combined talent and experience of Terraphase's engineers, geologists, and scientists form the foundation for a comprehensive environmental management approach.


Terraphase was founded with the goal of developing a full-service engineering and consulting firm that provides high-quality services to clients with regional and nationwide operations. We are driven by creating valuable work products for our company and clients, and a rewarding environment for our employees. Our staff is comprised of registered professionals in civil engineering, geology, hydrogeology, and geotechnical engineering.


Our unique company culture philosophy of appreciating and recognizing individuals for their work, leadership, and mentoring, while supporting and encouraging a healthy personal and professional lifestyle help to make Terraphase one of the best places to work.

***Benefits***


Terraphase offers an extensive benefits package including; Medical, Dental, Vision, Employer Paid Life Insurance, Long-Term Disability, a generous 401(k) match, Commuter Benefits, TerraLunches, TerraTalks, Tuition/Licensing/Professional Development Reimbursement, Flexible Work Schedule, ongoing company-sponsored events.

***EOE STATEMENT***


Terraphase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to an inclusive & diverse work environment where individual strengths and diverse viewpoints are respected and complement each other to achieve common goals. (EOE M/V/F/D)

title: Assistant Manager(03981)-127 Main Street
description:
**Company Description**  

One of the largest Franchisee in the tristate area. A company where People are first. We love our team members, and we create an environment where you can provide for your family and grow in the company.

 **Job Description**  

  

**ABOUT THE JOB**
You were born to be the boss. We know. You get up in the morning and you make sure everyone else in the house is doing what they need to do. Then you go to work and you make sure that everyone there is doing what they need to do, even your boss. You just do that because you've always done it. Well maybe it's time you moved up. You want to be the boss? Well now's your chance - Domino's Pizza is hiring bosses - more specifically assistant managers. It's a tough job, one that needs a natural like you. Of course, you'll need some skills - judgment, math and the ability to multitask.


You'll be working for a company that's fun and flexible. Not to mention, it's work experience you're going to use for a long time to come. You've had our pizza delivered to you, now help us be the best in pizza delivery. Go on, boss, show us what you've got. Apply now!

**JOB REQUIREMENTS AND DUTIES**


You are responsible for everything that happens during your shift. This includes all cost controls, inventory control, cash control and Customer relations. You must set the example. You must follow ALL policy and procedures 100% of the time and expect the same from your crew.


In addition: Staffing, Paperwork, Cost Controls, Cash control, Food management, Work to a Schedule, Perfect Image and adherence to standards, Great Customer Service, Attendance & punctuality, Transportation to/from work, Store cleanliness, Marketing, Profitability.

**ADVANCEMENT**


Many of our team members began their careers as delivery drivers and today are successful Domino's franchise owners. From assistant manager to general manager, general manager to franchisee or Manager Corporate Operations, our stores offer a world of opportunity.

**DIVERSITY**


Our mission is to recognize, appreciate, value and utilize the unique talents and contributions of all individuals. To create an environment where all team members, because of their differences, can reach their highest potential.

**SUMMARY STATEMENT**


We take pride in our team members and our team members take pride in Domino's Pizza! Being the best pizza delivery company in the world requires exceptional team members working together. At Domino's Pizza, our people come first!

**General Job Duties For All Store Team Members**

* Operate all equipment.
* Stock ingredients from delivery area to storage, work area, walk-in cooler.
* Prepare product.
* Receive and process telephone orders.
* Take inventory and complete associated paperwork.
* Clean equipment and facility approximately daily.

**Training**


Orientation and training provided on the job.

**Communication Skills**

* Ability to comprehend and give correct written instructions.
* Ability to communicate verbally with customers and co-workers to process orders both over the phone and in person.

**Essential Functions/Skills**

* Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide accurately and quickly (may use calculator).
* Must be able to make correct monetary change.
* Verbal, writing, and telephone skills to take and process orders. Motor coordination between eyes and hands/fingers to rapidly and accurately make precise movements with speed.
* Ability to enter orders using a computer keyboard or touch screen.
* Navigational skills to read a map, locate addresses within designated delivery area.
* Must navigate adverse terrain including multi-story buildings, private homes, and other delivery sites while carrying product.

**Work Conditions**

**EXPOSURE TO**

* Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when removing trash and performing other outside tasks.
* In-store temperatures range from 36 degrees in cooler to 90 degrees and above in some work areas.
* Sudden changes in temperature in work area and while outside.
* Fumes from food odors.
* Exposure to cornmeal dust.
* Cramped quarters including walk-in cooler.
* Hot surfaces/tools from oven up to 500 degrees or higher.
* Sharp edges and moving mechanical parts.
* Varying and sometimes adverse weather conditions when delivering product, driving and couponing.

**SENSING**

* Talking and hearing on telephone. Near and mid-range vision for most in-store tasks.
* Depth perception.
* Ability to differentiate between hot and cold surfaces.
* Far vision and night vision for driving.

**TEMPERAMENTS**


The ability to direct activities, perform repetitive tasks, work alone and with others, work under stress, meet strict quality control standards, deal with people, analyze and compile data, make judgments and decisions.

 **Additional Information**  

  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**, including, but not limited to the following:**Standing**


Most tasks are performed from a standing position. Walking surfaces include ceramic tile "bricks" with linoleum in some food process areas. Height of work surfaces is between 36" and 48".

**Walking**

* For short distances for short durations
* Delivery personnel must travel between the store and delivery vehicle and from the delivery vehicle to the customer's location.

**Sitting**


Paperwork is normally completed in an office at a desk or table

**Lifting**

* Bulk product deliveries are made twice a week or more and are unloaded by the team member using a hand truck.
* Deliveries may include cases of ingredients and supplies weighing up to 50 pounds with dimensions of up to 3' x 1.5'.
* Cases are usually lifted from floor and stacked onto shelves up to 72" high.

**Carrying**

* Large cans, weighing 3 pounds, 7 ounces, are carried from the workstation to storage shelves.
* Occasionally, pizza sauce weighing 30 pounds is carried from the storage room to the front of the store.
* Trays of pizza dough are carried three at a time over short distances, and weigh approximately 12 pounds per tray.

* During delivery, carry pizzas and beverages while performing "walking" and "climbing" duties.

**Pushing**

* To move trays which are placed on dollies.
* A stack of trays on a dolly is approximately 24" - 30" and requires a force of up to 7.5 pounds to push.
* Trays may also be pulled.

**Climbing**

* Team members must infrequently navigate stairs or climb a ladder to change prices on signs, wash walls, perform maintenance.
* During delivery of product, navigation of five or more flights of stairs may be required.

**Stooping/Bending**

* Forward bending at the waist is necessary at the pizza assembly station.
* Toe room is present, but workers are unable to flex their knees while standing at this station.
* Duration of this position is approximately 30 - 45 seconds at one time, repeated continuously during the day.
* Forward bending is also present at the front counter and when stocking ingredients.

**Crouching/Squatting**


Performed occasionally to stock shelves and to clean low areas.

**Reaching**

* Reaching is performed continuously; up, down and forward.
* Workers reach above 72" occasionally to turn on/off oven controls, change prices on sign, and lift and lower objects to and from shelves.
* Workers reaching down to perform such tasks as scooping cornmeal from a plastic barrel, or washing dishes.
* Workers reach forward when obtaining topping ingredients, cleaning work surfaces, or answering phones.

**Driving**

* Deliver pizzas within a designated delivery area. A Team Member may make several deliveries per shift.

**Hand Tasks**

* Eye-hand coordination is essential. Use of hands is continuous during the day.
* Frequently activities require use of one or both hands. Shaping pizza dough requires frequent and forceful use of forearms and wrists.
* Workers must manipulate a pizza peel when removing pizza from the oven, and when using the rolling cutter.
* Frequent and/or forceful pinching is required in the assembly of cardboard pizza boxes.
* Team Members must be able to grasp cans, the phone, the pizza cutter and pizza peel, and pizza boxes.

**Machines, Tools, Equipment, Work Aids**


Team Members may be required to utilize pencils/pens, computers, telephones, calculators, TDD equipment, pizza cutter and pizza peel.

**Driving Specific Job Duties**

* Deliver product by car and then to door of customer.
* Deliver flyers and door hangers.

**Requires**

* Valid driver's license with safe driving record meeting company standards.
* Access to insured vehicle which can be used for delivery.

title: HR Assistant

title: Associate Director of Social Work - BH Social Work Training Academy, MPA Behavioral Health Administration *Grant Funded*
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**


NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


Under direction of the System Director of Social Work, the Associate Director will assist in the oversight of Social Work practice and care delivery of Behavioral Health services. This role demands a dynamic and forward-thinking professional with a strong commitment to Social Work excellence, policy development, and inter-organizational collaboration. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional leadership skills, a strategic mindset, and the ability to drive impactful change across the social work services spectrum. This position requires a blend of clinical expertise, leadership skills, and administrative acumen to ensure the efficient functioning and the provision of high-quality care.

* Support the Systemwide Director of Social Work in the conceptualization, planning, and execution of innovative social work service delivery models and best practices in our behavioral health services.
* Partner in the co-creation of comprehensive policy and practice frameworks pertaining to the Social Work discipline and workforce development in the areas of Behavioral Health such as Outpatient, Inpatient, CPEP/PES, Child Services, Substance Abuse Services and Crisis Care.
* Champion the integration of behavioral health services into non-BH settings by collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to develop and implement strategies that enhance access to and delivery of behavioral health services in diverse healthcare environments.
* Conduct thorough assessments to identify areas for enhancement within social work services and propose strategic initiatives to bolster their effectiveness and efficiency.
* Provide expert advice to the Director on policy adjustments, procedural enhancements, workforce management, and staff development, ensuring alignment with best practices and organizational goals as well as enhancing patient care for our behavioral health patients.
* Forge and maintain collaborative relationships with community organizations, government agencies, and advocacy groups to address clinical care challenges, social determinants of health, and promote health equity.
* Oversee and manage social work-related Electronic Health Record (EPIC) demands, leveraging EMR functionality to enhance practice and streamline operations.
* Provide specialized social work consultation to support program operations and facilitate successful grant development initiatives for the Office of Behavioral Health.
* Act as a liaison with community agencies and professional organizations, fostering productive relationships and addressing mutual concerns with hospital and other functionally related officials as related to behavioral health initiatives and patients.
* Participate actively in appointed meetings and conferences, representing the Director comprehensively in all delegated duties and responsibilities.
* Collaborate closely with facility-based leadership or designated champions to drive behavioral health social work special initiatives that align with organizational objectives.
* Prepare detailed reports, studies, and budgetary estimates to support informed decision-making and strategic planning when necessary.
* Undertake any additional duties as assigned to support the overall mission and objectives of the social work program and the organization.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master's Degree (MSW) from an accredited School of Social Work and certification by the State of New York; and,


2. Six years of experience in clinical social work, of which three years are in a health care or medical care setting including psychiatric and medical social work, and three years in a supervisory, consultative and administrative capacity in an organization adhering to acceptable standards with knowledge of administration, with administrative and managerial skills and abilities; or,


3. A satisfactory completion of education, training and experience which includes at least a Master's Degree from an accredited School of Social Work, plus certification from the New York State Department of Education; and,


4. Demonstrated ability to function productively and cooperatively with Director of Social Work, Medical Staff, Administrative Staff and to supervise effectively.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------



* Licensure (LMSW or LCSW) issued by The New York State Education Department (NYSED)


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Clinical Business Analyst Level II - SUD Acute Care Services, MPA Behavioral Health Administration *Grant Funded*
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**


NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------



* Oversee data reporting for all H+H SUD acute care-funded initiatives within H+H SUD programs as well as those managed through the Office of Behavioral Health (OBH).
* Oversee development and optimization of SUD acute care services dashboarding, Epic electronic medical record (EMR) clinical documentation tools, and reports to inform QI and satisfy grant funding deliverables.
* Provide data validation, especially for totals, rates, and additional statistical statements published in reports and dashboards.
* Provide descriptive and analytical reports, including tables, graphs, and figures; adhere to deadlines for regular periodic reporting and fulfill ad hoc requests for targeted data and analyses.
* Partner with dashboard/report sponsors to gather requirements, document business processes and workflows, and explore potential solutions with the service delivery teams.
* Interview end users and stakeholders to assess business and clinical needs; create business, functional, and technical requirement documents based on captured data and, in accordance with departmental protocols and standards.
* Create data solutions that support the stakeholder’s need for report generation, automation, scripting, coding and/or troubleshooting.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and provide analysis and propose change and communicate strategies.
* Communicate requirements to technical personnel through the construction of basic conceptual data, process models and flowcharts, and technical specifications.
* Verify that solutions meet business, compliance, and technical requirements prior to publication.
* Provide SUD acute care service project management assistance with the development, implementation, and optimization of programmatic workflows.
* Plan, organize, facilitate, and lead meetings and workgroups around SUD data and assigned workflows; oversee and execute follow-up activities.
* Liaise with academic or other partners to support programmatic evaluation/research.
* Participate in behavioral health/SUD departmental and interdepartmental meetings.
* Contribution to peer-reviewed publications and conference presentations on SUD service interventions, highlighting outcomes and informing best practices for future programming.
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor and departmental leadership


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis or related in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or


2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience as described above; or


3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.


4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------

  


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and other Requirements:

* Minimum 2 years of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements for software applications development and implementation in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area
* Experience with or exposure to data analysis in SQL, SAS, R, Python, Microsoft Excel, and Tableau
* Experience analyzing EMR-derived data is a priority
* Experience working effectively in a public hospital setting or a closely related field including long-term, acute, ambulatory care, medical service administration, public administration, or within substance use programming

  


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Warehouse Associate (Part Time)
Warehouse Associate (Overnight)
Vice President, Institutional Securities Group Central Risk Team
description:
Vice President, Institutional Securities Group Central Risk Team

Job Number:

 3259283


POSTING DATE: Sep 17, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
JOB: Investment Banking/Sales/Trading/Research
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  

Department Profile  

Morgan Stanley’s Institutional Securities Group is underpinned by complex trading technology which continually evolves to meet the needs of our clients, the Firm, the venues we execute on and the increasing regulatory focus from our regulators in the US, Europe, and Asia.  

Role Summary  

Morgan Stanley’s Institutional Securities Central Risk Team (CRT) is looking for a Vice President to join the Non-Financial Risk Group 1st Line of Defense function, to focus on the execution and governance of multiple cross-divisional activities within the Operational Risk space.  

Primary Responsibilities  

* Work with CRT team to identify risks, define controls, and assess effectiveness of the ISG control environment
* Act as the primary interface with key ISG business partners and provide regular updates on the status of the risk and controls framework execution
* Ability to analyze a process and recommend ways to improve quality, controls, and efficiency
* Work with management and team leads across global ISG business unit functions to assess, measure and resolve risk issues as appropriate
* Support the identification, operationalization and monitoring of key non-financial risk metrics/management indicators, including delivery of management reporting
* Provide expert support and advice to the business on risk identification and risk mitigation for identified and future risks
* Support continuous growth of the ISG NFR central framework through risk review, lessons learned, and changes in the non-financial risk landscape
* Facilitate cross functional teams to support new initiatives and drive discussions on control design and/or issue remediation to ensure corresponding actions will be effectively remediated and evidenced
  


QUALIFICATIONS


Critical Success Factors:  

* Strategic thinker with experience coordinating and collaborating with multiple stakeholder groups, including senior Firm and Business Unit management
* Self-confident leader possessing a collaborative and participatory management style and strong work ethic
* Experience with meeting critical deadlines, as well as tracking and driving execution
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and advance multiple priorities in a fast-changing environment
* A skilled communicator, both written and verbal, with an ability to influence others at all levels
* Strong attention to detail and organization skills
* Assessment, process, and control-oriented mindset
* Professionalism, sensitivity, sound judgment and discretion
* Familiarity with risk-management best practices and controls


Qualifications:  

* 7+ years of related work experience in risk management functions or related roles
* Understanding of and familiarity with financial services industry (knowledge of sales and trading, audit, compliance or regulatory processes preferred)
* Bachelor’s degree required


Expected base pay rate for the role will be between $145,000 and $250,000 for Vice President, at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages,  

and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. title: International Business Officer - VP
description:
International Business Officer - VP

Job Number:

 3258912


POSTING DATE: Sep 17, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-Purchase
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Graystone Consulting, an investment consulting business of Morgan Stanley that provides investment advice to institutional clients representing approximately $500 billion in assets under advisement, is seeking an International Business Officer. This person will report to Morgan Stanley’s Head of Institutional Product Development and be responsible for supporting the growth and development of Graystone’s international business. This individual will work closely with Morgan Stanley’s International Wealth Management Team, Graystone’s management team, and financial consultants who focus on servicing international clients.  


Role Responsibilities:
* Supporting new business development and marketing of Morgan Stanley’s capabilities to international clients and prospects; providing ongoing business support to consultants, including assistance with RFPs, finals presentations and client contracts;

  


* Identifying cross-sell opportunities and collaborating with other Morgan Stanley partners to deliver an integrated firm;

  


* Enhancing capabilities to support and grow the international business;

  


* Reporting results internally and maintaining compliance with all international rules, policies and procedures;

  


* Managing and overseeing the appropriate execution of customized terms;

  


* Leading additional projects related to Graystone business controls and procedures.
  


QUALIFICATIONS


Knowledge and Skills Required:


* Series 7 and Series 24 registrations required


* Bachelors degree


* 5+ years of financial services experience with at least 2 years of international financial services experience
* Strong work ethic and detail orientation, with ability to handle a significant volume of customized work in a timely manner


* Strong written, verbal and interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with Legal, Risk, Audit, and other support teams


* Strong business judgment and professionalism



Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.

 Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).



 Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $110,000 and $185,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs
